articles.headline: Cadillac Ad Tries to Bridge Nation’s Chasm, Without Falling In
articles.snippet: On the Oscars broadcast, the message will be working together to overcome challenges. But these days, can even invoking unity be a risk for a brand?
articles.abstract: On the Oscars broadcast, the message will be working together to overcome challenges. But these days, can even invoking unity be a risk for a brand?
articles.lead_paragraph: Can a luxury auto ad help bridge the deep political chasm in America — and, while it’s at it, sell cars?

articles.headline: Weakened Democrats Bow to Voters, Opting for Total War on Trump
articles.snippet: After the election, Democrats debated whether to confront the president or seek compromise, but riled-up liberals have pushed party leaders into an all-out fight.
articles.abstract: After the election, Democrats debated whether to confront the president or seek compromise, but riled-up liberals have pushed party leaders into an all-out fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Reduced to their weakest state in a generation, Democratic Party leaders will gather in two cities this weekend to plot strategy and select a new national chairman with the daunting task of rebuilding the party’s depleted organization. But senior Democratic officials concede that the blueprint has already been chosen for them — by an incensed army of liberals demanding no less than total war against President Trump.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: As Kelly and Tillerson Visit Mexico, Their Reassurances Differ From Trump’s Stance
articles.snippet: Top U.S. officials held a news conference in Mexico City as policy announcements from the White House continue to enrage the Mexican public.
articles.abstract: Top U.S. officials held a news conference in Mexico City as policy announcements from the White House continue to enrage the Mexican public.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — In the White House, President Trump was telling American chief executives on Thursday that the days of being treated unfairly by Mexico — on trade, on immigration, on crime — were over.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed, Gardiner Harris and Ron Nixon

articles.headline: Bathroom Case Puts Transgender Student on National Stage
articles.snippet: Gavin Grimm, 17, whose initials are on a case heading to the Supreme Court, has become the new face of the transgender rights movement.
articles.abstract: Gavin Grimm, 17, whose initials are on a case heading to the Supreme Court, has become the new face of the transgender rights movement.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The bespectacled teenager in the gray A.C.L.U. hoodie and cargo pants stood, back pressed against a chain-link fence on Pennsylvania Avenue, under a sign saying “No Trespassing, Authorized Personnel Only.” The White House, illuminated at night, cast a glow over well-wishers who, having just wrapped up a protest against President Trump, waited in line to pay homage to 17-year-old Gavin Grimm.

articles.headline: Counting on the Trendy to Revive Kava, a Traditional Drink
articles.snippet: Pacific Island governments and others are working to modernize cultivation of kava, hoping that the drink’s popularity can be sustained.
articles.abstract: Pacific Island governments and others are working to modernize cultivation of kava, hoping that the drink’s popularity can be sustained.
articles.lead_paragraph: VATUKALO, Fiji — Before kava makes its way to a new wave of trendy bars in places like Brooklyn and Berkeley, Calif., it must be nurtured and plucked by people like Livai Tavesivesi.

articles.headline: Snapchat Founders’ Grip Tightened After a Spat With an Early Investor
articles.snippet: A big question about the I.P.O. of Snap is why its creators retain such outsize voting control. The answer lies in their history with a venture capital firm.
articles.abstract: A big question about the I.P.O. of Snap is why its creators retain such outsize voting control. The answer lies in their history with a venture capital firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Snap goes public next month, one of the biggest winners will be Lightspeed Venture Partners.

articles.headline: Google Self-Driving Car Unit Accuses Uber of Using Stolen Technology
articles.snippet: A lawsuit says an employee took thousands of secret files on self-driving car design when he left Google to start his own company, later sold to Uber.
articles.abstract: A lawsuit says an employee took thousands of secret files on self-driving car design when he left Google to start his own company, later sold to Uber.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Waymo, the self-driving car business spun out of Google’s parent company, claimed in a federal lawsuit on Thursday that Uber was using intellectual property stolen by one of Google’s former project leaders.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Stephen Bannon Reassures Conservatives Uneasy About Trump
articles.snippet: The president’s chief strategist vowed that the “deconstruction of the administrative state” has begun, in a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference.
articles.abstract: The president’s chief strategist vowed that the “deconstruction of the administrative state” has begun, in a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference.
articles.lead_paragraph: OXON HILL, Md. — In an administration hardly five weeks old, Stephen K. Bannon’s reputation has taken on almost mythic proportion as a fire-breathing populist, emerging power center, man of mystery.

articles.headline: China Names Guo Shuqing, a Rapid-Fire Regulator, to Oversee Troubled Banks
articles.snippet: The appointment of the respected official could signal Beijing’s desire to address deep financial problems holding back the Chinese economy.
articles.abstract: The appointment of the respected official could signal Beijing’s desire to address deep financial problems holding back the Chinese economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As a top stock market regulator, Guo Shuqing cemented a reputation as an economic reformer who tried to bring market-oriented changes to China’s fraud-ridden and heavily politicized financial system.

articles.headline: Hate Crime Is Feared as 2 Indian Engineers Are Shot in Kansas
articles.snippet: India’s government expressed shock after one citizen was killed and another wounded in a bar in suburban Kansas.
articles.abstract: India’s government expressed shock after one citizen was killed and another wounded in a bar in suburban Kansas.
articles.lead_paragraph: OLATHE, Kan. — “The Jameson guys,” as some on the staff at Austins Bar and Grill knew the pair, were on the patio on Wednesday evening. It was hardly unusual: Srinivas Kuchibhotla and Alok Madasani, two immigrants from India, often enjoyed an after-work whiskey at the bar they had adopted as a hangout.
articles.byline: By John Eligon, Alan Blinder and Nida Najar

articles.headline: Republicans Want You in a Health Savings Account. So Now What?
articles.snippet: Major proposals to replace the Affordable Care Act promote health savings accounts, which do offer tax savings but are complex and favor the wealthy.
articles.abstract: Major proposals to replace the Affordable Care Act promote health savings accounts, which do offer tax savings but are complex and favor the wealthy.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’ve been watching the debate in Washington over what is to become of our health insurance plans, you know that Republicans already disagree on a whole bunch of things. They’re not sure about what any new plan will cost. They’re not sure how any new tax credits should work or who should get them. They’re not sure about how Medicaid should operate.

articles.headline: Trump’s Blistering Speech at CPAC Follows Bannon’s Blueprint
articles.snippet: A day after his secretive chief strategist spoke at the annual conservative conference, the president delivered a visceral gut punch of a speech.
articles.abstract: A day after his secretive chief strategist spoke at the annual conservative conference, the president delivered a visceral gut punch of a speech.
articles.lead_paragraph: OXON HILL, Md. — Stephen K. Bannon brought the battle plan. President Trump brought the fight.
